dcterms:description: Channelrhodopsin-2 (ChR2) is a light-gated ion channel with three states: Closed, Open, and Desensitized. It is used as a control mechanism in neuroscience experiments.
dcterms:title: Channelrhodopsin-2 (ChR2)

dcterms:creator: Douglas M Fambrough
Daniel B Drachman
S Satyamurti
dcterms:description: The Acetylcholine (ACh) receptor is a ligand-gated ion channel with five states. It converts the chemical neurotransmitter signal into muscle-activating currents.
dcterms:title: Acetylcholine (ACh)

dcterms:creator: D. Colquhoun
A. G. Hawkes
dcterms:description: Rate parameters for Acetylcholine (ACh) detailing the stochastic properties of bursts of single ion channel openings and clusters of bursts.
dcterms:title: Rate parameters for ACh

dcterms:creator: G. Nagel

dcterms:description: Rate parameters for Channelrhodopsin-2 (ChR2) detailing the stochastic properties of the ion channel's state transitions.
dcterms:title: Rate parameters for ChR2
